title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of shutdowns, with a total of 15 data points.
Overall Number of shutdowns has increased over the Year

Number of shutdowns is rapidly increasing from 2005 to 2006, rapidly decreasing from 2006 to 2007, rapidly increasing from 2007 to 2009, rapidly decreasing from 2009 to 2010, rapidly increasing from 2010 to 2011, rapidly decreasing from 2011 to 2012, rapidly increasing from 2012 to 2013, rapidly decreasing from 2013 to 2014, rapidly increasing from 2014 to 2015, gradually decreasing from 2015 to 2016, rapidly increasing from 2016 to 2018, and lastly gradually decreasing from 2018 to 2019.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2010 and 2011.
Max Number of shutdowns about 13.0 was recorded at Year 2011
Min Number of shutdowns about 1.0 was recorded at Year 2007,  2010, and 2014
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of shutdowns, with a total of 15 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2016 to 2019.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2007 to 2010.
Also, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2014 to 2016.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly increasing which exists from 2012 to 2014.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2010 to 2012.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2005 to 2007.
